name: Book of friends
detailed_description: Book of friends is a web application designed to cater to the needs of a fictional small library that offers a diverse range of media, including books, comics/manga, movies, and albums. The application allows the subscriber to view a document and check its availability and reserve an item if it's not already reserved or waiting to be picked. Users must be logged in to reserve a document or register if they do not have an account, once they reserve a document an email is sent to the assigned email when the document is ready to be picked. For the administrator, it allows him to consult, modify, add, delete a document and view the list of the documents that have been reserved.
short_description: Book of friends is a web application offering seamless document browsing, real-time availability checks, and easy reservations with email notifications. Administrators enjoy comprehensive inventory management and reservation tracking.

name: BOF API
detailed_description: The Book of friends API serves as the backend for the Book of friends Web application. It utilizes the Node.js server and MongoDB database, employing JavaScript language throughout. The API employs various HTTP methods including GET, DELETE, PUT, and POST to handle different operations. The MongoDB database is utilized to store various data including user profiles, services details, and even images associated with services. Models are employed to structure and manage data within the MongoDB database effectively. The API is designed to facilitate communication between the Android application and the server/database, allowing for seamless retrieval, manipulation, and storage of data necessary for the Book of friends application's functionality.
short_description: The Book of friends API is designed to handle CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations, facilitating smooth interaction between the Web application and the server, with MongoDB as the database solution, and JavaScript as the primary programming language.

name: Near me (Samy's Version)
detailed_description: Near me (Samy's Version) is the re-record of Near Me that was done in 2022. It's an innovative Android application designed to streamline the process of finding services such as gardening or hairdressing, while also empowering individuals to offer their services. Within the application, users can easily browse through a variety of services posted by others, allowing for quick and convenient contact through the app itself. Additionally, users have the option to save their favorite services or service providers for future reference. To utilize the full functionality of the app, users are required to create an account by logging in with either their email or phone number. For those who are new to the platform, signing up is a breeze, with the option to input personal details such as full name and birth date. Individuals looking to offer their services can easily do so by publishing listings that include relevant details such as service offerings and location, supplemented with accompanying pictures for enhanced visibility. Moreover, Near Me SV prioritizes user control and privacy. Users have the flexibility to manage their profiles, enabling them to delete their accounts at any time or update personal information and passwords. Additionally, users can easily remove any services they have published, ensuring complete autonomy over their listings. Near Me SV has been developed Kotlin language within the Android Studio environment, ensuring a smooth and intuitive user experience for all.
short_description: Near Me SV revolutionizes service discovery and provision with its user-friendly Android application. By offering a diverse range of services like gardening and hairdressing, users can easily connect with local providers or advertise their own offerings.

name: NMSV API

It utilizes the Node.js server and MongoDB database, employing JavaScript language throughout. The API employs various HTTP methods including GET, DELETE, PUT, and POST to handle different operations. The MongoDB database is utilized to store various data including user profiles, services details, and even images associated with services. The API is designed to facilitate communication between the Android application and the server/database, allowing for seamless retrieval, manipulation, and storage of data necessary for the Near Me (Samy's Version) application's functionality.

name: Near me

Within the application, users can easily browse through a variety of services posted by others. Additionally, users have the option to save their favorite services or service providers for future reference. To utilize the full functionality of the app, users are required to create an account by logging in with either their email or phone number. For those who are new to the platform, signing up is a breeze, with the option to input personal details such as full name and birth date. Individuals looking to offer their services can easily do so by publishing listings that include relevant details such as service offerings and location, supplemented with accompanying pictures for enhanced visibility. Moreover, Near Me prioritizes user control and privacy. name: NM API
detailed_description: The Near Me API serves as the backend for the Near Me Android application. It utilizes the Node.js server and Sql database, employing JavaScript language throughout. The API employs various HTTP methods including GET, DELETE, PUT, and POST to handle different operations. The Sql server is utilized to store various data including user profiles, services details, and even images associated with services. Thus, Firebase is used for user's management and store pictures. The Near Me API was also deployed using Heroku. The API is designed to facilitate communication between the Android application and the server/database, allowing for seamless retrieval, manipulation, and storage of data necessary for the Near Me application's functionality.
short_description: Near Me API is designed to handle CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations, facilitating smooth interaction between the Android application and the server, with Sql server as the database solution and Firebase for users and pictures management, and JavaScript as the primary programming language.
